data.name: Corvette_AtlantisX32Description
data.value: The Atlantis X23 is the smallest model of destroyer, and its combination of frigate-like size and corvette-like power makes it an excellent escort ship when defending larger ships against multiple smaller enemies. Because the Atlantis X23 is fitted with a jump drive, it can also serve as an intersystem patrol craft.

data.name: Corvette_AtlantisX32Name
data.value: Atlantis X23

data.name: Corvette_AtlantisX32PDescription
data.value: A refitted Atlantis X23 for more general tasks.The large shield system has been replaced with an advanced combat maneuvering systems and improved impulse engines.Its missile loadout is also more diverse.Mistaking the modified Atlantis for an Atlantis X23 would be a deadly mistake.

data.name: Corvette_AtlantisX32PName
data.value: Atlantis X23 NX

data.name: Fighter_AdderMk4Description
data.value: The mark 4 Adder is a rare sight these days due to the success its successor, the mark 5 Adder, which often replaces this model.Its similar hull, however, means careless buyers are sometimes conned into buying mark 4 models disguised as the mark 5.

data.name: Fighter_AdderMk4Name
data.value: Adder Mk. IV

data.name: Fighter_AdderMk5Description
data.value: The Adder line's fifth iteration proved to be a great success among pirates and law officers alike. It is cheap, fast, and easy to maintain, and it packs a decent punch.

data.name: Fighter_AdderMk5Name
data.value: Adder Mk. V

data.name: Fighter_AdderMk6Description
data.value: The mark 6 Adder is a small upgrade compared to the highly successful mark 5 model.Since people still prefer the more familiar and reliable mark 5, the mark 6 has not seen the same level of success.

data.name: Fighter_AdderMk6Name
data.value: Adder Mk. VI

data.name: Fighter_HornetDescription
data.value: The MT52 Hornet is a basic interceptor found in many corners of the galaxy.It's easy to find spare parts for MT52s, not only because they are produced in large numbers, but also because they suffer high losses in combat.

data.name: Fighter_HornetMk2Description
data.value: The MU52 Hornet is a new, upgraded version of the MT52. All of its systems are slightly improved over the MT52 model.

data.name: Fighter_HornetMk2Name
data.value: MU52 Hornet Mk. II

data.name: Fighter_HornetMk3Description
data.value: The MP52 Hornet is a significantly upgraded version of MU52 Hornet, with nearly twice the hull strength, nearly three times the shielding, better acceleration, impulse boosters, and a second laser cannon.

data.name: Fighter_HornetMk3Name
data.value: MP52 Hornet Mk. III

data.name: Fighter_HornetName
data.value: MT52 Hornet

data.name: Fighter_LindwormDescription
data.value: The WX - Lindworm, or "Worm" as it's often called, is a bomber-class starfighter. While one of the least-shielded starfighters in active duty, the Worm's two launchers can pack quite a punch.Its goal is to fly in, destroy its target, and fly out or be destroyed.

data.name: Fighter_LindwormName
data.value: WX-Lindworm

data.name: HugeStationDescription
data.value: The size of a sprawling town, stations at this scale represent a faction's center of space-borne power in a region. They serve many functions at once and represent an extensive investment of time, money, and labor. A huge station's shields and thick hull can keep it intact long enough for reinforcements to arrive, even when faced with an ongoing siege or massive, perfectly coordinated assault.

data.name: HugeStationName
data.value: Huge Station

data.name: LargeStationDescription
data.value: These space-borne communities often represent permanent bases in a sector.Stations of this size can be military installations, commercial hubs, deep - space settlements, and small shipyards.Only a concentrated attack can penetrate a large station's shields, and its hull can withstand all but the most powerful weaponry.

data.name: LargeStationName
data.value: Large Station

data.name: MediumStationDescription
data.value: Large enough to accommodate small crews for extended periods of times, stations of this size are often trading posts, refueling bases, mining operations, and forward military bases.While their shields are strong, concerted attacks by many ships can bring them down quickly.

data.name: MediumStationName
data.value: Medium Station

data.name: SmallStationDescription
data.value: Stations of this size are often used as research outposts, listening stations, and security checkpoints.Crews turn over frequently in a small station's cramped accommodations, but they are small enough to look like ships on many long-range sensors, and organized raiders sometimes take advantage of this by placing small stations in nebulae to serve as raiding bases. They are lightly shielded and vulnerable to swarming assaults.

data.name: SmallStationName
data.value: Small Station
